attributes.action: Strip Irvine Patnick of his knighthood now!
attributes.additional_details:
Following the outrageous dishonesty which has been exposed as a result of the disclosure of the long-awaited Hillsborough files, the integrity, standing, and qualification of those colluding in the cover up has been shown as being unfit to hold state honours or privileges of any kind.

Irvine Patnick, Conservative MP for Sheffield Hallam at the time of Hillsborough, has been proven as having worked in partnership with Kelvin McKenzie, then editor of The Sun, to concoct an enduring and spiteful web of lies, mistruths, and slanderous comments against the dead, the dying, and those Liverpool FC fans trying to rescue the victims of the crush.

We therefore regard him as unfit to hold a knighthood or any other public honour, and demand that HM Government direct the forfeiture committee to advise HM Queen Elizabeth to strip Irvine Patnick of his knighthood and all other public honours he may hold forthwith.
